sentences: Ta on suuremat kui ta näeb välja.
context: 'Suuremat' is the comparative form of the adjective 'suur' (big/large). It means 'bigger', 'larger', or 'greater' in English. In Estonian, adjectives change their endings for grammatical cases and numbers. 'Suuremat' appears to be in the partitive case singular form used for comparison. This form is typically used when comparing two things - indicating that something is bigger than another thing.
